author: USA TODAY, Elizabeth Weise and Mark Johnson, USA TODAY
title: The first US coronavirus patients are being treated with convalescent plasma therapy. Will it work? Not even the doctors know.
description: At least five Americans have gotten blood plasma from people who's recovered coronavirus, an initial test in a global program created in three weeks.
content:
Why a treatment used for over a century on diseases like measles, mumps and influenza could work to treat the new coronavirus strain.
USA TODAY
In New York and Houston, pints of straw-colored convalescent plasma have dripped into the veins of five U.S. coro… [+10722 chars]
